text: House Speaker Bowers push kibosh on @HeatherCarterAZ legislation to require a special tuition category for dreamers and other AZ high school grads who don't otherwise qualify for in-state rate.
author: azcapmedia

text: ... depends on how closely they pat you down....
author: azcapmedia

text: Stringer's attorney says if Ethics Committee wants the letter from the DC bar about what it found looking into his 1983 arrest they're gonna have to get a court.
author: azcapmedia

text: AZ jobless rate unchanged at 5.1 percent (versus 3.8 percent for US), with construction industry continuing to add jobs as state recovers from the recession, housing bubble and overbuilt market.
author: azcapmedia

text: Attorney for David Stringer says the Ethics Committee can have the document it wants. It just needs to file a legal action because of protective order signed by state's presiding disciplinary judge. But @TJShopeforAZ insists that's not the case. https://azcapitoltimes.com/news/2019/03/21/stringer-attorney-hands-are-tied-on-disclosing-documents/ …
author: azcapmedia

text: @DrRandyFriese tries to get House to clarify that the 2010 medical marijuana law always intended to allow patients to use extracts and edibles. But only one Republican -- Noel Cambell -- agrees to go along.
author: azcapmedia

text: AZ jobless rate unchanged at 5.1 percent as construction industry continues to show signs of post-recession life, though nowhere where it was before bottom dropped out of housing market. https://tucson.com/business/arizona-jobless-rate-unchanged/article_2e0c6ba4-aaa6-58ec-ac42-cf835b22f653.html …
author: azcapmedia

text: Republicans -- at least most of them -- reject proposal by @DrRandyFriese to clarify in law that extracts and edible forms of marijuana are legal for patients. @recobbforazrep says it's attractive to children. Only Noel Campbell breaks ranks with GOP. https://tucson.com/news/local/arizona-house-rejects-proposal-to-clarify-that-edible-medical-pot/article_acd50b68-22bf-58d7-9418-625d52149a63.html?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=share&id=201408 …
author: azcapmedia

text: That demand by the Ethics Committee for the report by the DC Bar on Stringer? His attorney says they need a court order as the state's chief disciplinary judge has ordered it protected. Yet @TJShopeforAZ insists Stringer can release it. https://azcapitoltimes.com/news/2019/03/21/stringer-attorney-hands-are-tied-on-disclosing-documents/ …
author: azcapmedia

text: ICYMI: Supreme Court debate on whether marijuana extracts are legal goes to questions of whether the 2010 law anticipated 2-year-olds rolling joints and how to be sure your brownies have the desired effect.
author: azcapmedia

text: Senate panel rebuffs Thorpe proposal to strengthen AZ's seat belt laws by extending requirement to back-seat occupants and allowing cops to pull over non-complaint motorists (tho they could issue only a warning).
author: azcapmedia

text: Department of Revenue puts $33 M price tag on @MichelleUgenti proposal to clarify which digital products are taxable. She's unfazed, says state and cities should not be taxing in the first place.
author: azcapmedia

text: Ethics Committee to Stringer: Yes, you will turn over the documents we want (and submit to interview). No, we won't promise to keep the documents secret. Stringer has til this coming Wednesday to decide what he will do.
author: azcapmedia

text: Those in back seats of cars still don't have to buckle up as Senate panel quashes Thorpe measure to expand seat belt law and allow cops to stop errant motorists without first having any other excuse. https://tucson.com/news/local/back-seaters-still-won-t-have-to-buckle-up-in/article_194bc644-6a48-5a6e-915f-8570e19f7f9e.html …
author: azcapmedia

text: $33 M price tag and opposition from cities leaves @MichelleUgenti without the votes for her legislation to clarify what items purchased or rented online are subject to state and local sales taxes. https://tucson.com/news/local/bill-lacks-votes-to-clarify-which-online-purchases-are-taxable/article_47239ceb-3128-50c0-8d9e-88f954bf0781.html …
author: azcapmedia

text: House Ethics panel rebuffs bid by Stringer that any documents he produces to committee be kept confidential, gives him until next Wednesday to cough up the materials and until March 29 to submit to interview by attorneys hired by the House.
author: azcapmedia

text: So why was this closed to the press?
author: azcapmedia

text: This from the Tucson speech that was not open to the press? What was so freakin' secret that @dougducey needed to tell the business community that he couldn't let the public?
author: azcapmedia

text: Colorado River basin states now seeking congressional approval for interstate drought contingency plan. But it's just a stop-gap as state expected to be dryer and hotter, meaning a new plan -- and further cuts -- by 2026. https://www.pinalcentral.com/breaking/states-now-seek-federal-approval-of-historic-drought-plan/article_5aafe1c2-0c0b-5e55-9411-6450b0cbbc21.html …
author: azcapmedia

text: Supreme Court justices grill prosecutor on his assumption that when voters legalized marijuana they didn't legalize extracts used to make edibles. And then there was this discussion of how to make marijuana brownies.... https://tucson.com/news/local/arizona-supreme-court-justices-question-arguments-against-medical-marijuana-extracts/article_d081d6b4-030b-57a7-abc9-c46328358f31.html …
author: azcapmedia

text: In case you missed this decision from Friday: Court of Appeals says woman at center of law over who gets embryos in case of divorce entitled to have them even tho ex doesn't want kids and contract requires consent of both to implant.
author: azcapmedia

text: House votes for @KellyTownsend11 bill to create new crimes in voter registration laws, a measure that @reginaldbolding says is designed to suppress minority voter turnout and protect more fringe elements of the GOP.
author: azcapmedia

text: AZ lawmakers moving to block cities and towns from enacting new laws to protect tenants, all at the behest of the group that represents landlords.
author: azcapmedia

text:
Supreme Court hears arguments on whether it's legal to sell anything under than leaves and flowers under the state's medical marijuana law. Oh, and there was a discussion of proper ways to make a marijuana brownie....
https://www.pinalcentral.com/arizona_news/state-supreme-court-hears-arguments-on-marijuana-extracts/article_d4b2afbe-0f7b-596e-aca6-a7896ae65d64.html …
author: azcapmedia

text: Water officials in Colorado River basin states now asking Congress to approve drought contingency plan. But pretty much no one believes this is long-term solution as the U.S. gets hotter and dryer.
author: azcapmedia

text: Scrambled eggs: AZ appellate court says that divorced woman entitled to the embryos frozen years before even though her now ex-husband points to contract provision that requires consent of BOTH to implant -- and he's not consenting. https://azcapitoltimes.com/news/2019/03/18/court-rules-divorced-woman-can-use-fertilized-embryos-against-fathers-wishes/ …
author: azcapmedia

text: $850 M deal likely will make a marijuana operation that started as a dispensary in Tempe the largest cultivator, processor and retailer in the nation for both medical and recreational use.
author: azcapmedia

text: Appellate court says the desire of a woman to have the frozen embryos to implant them outweighs the objections of her ex-husband who said he does not want to be a father. This case prompted a 2018 change in AZ law.
author: azcapmedia

text: Remember the days of buying a bag of marijuana from a guy up the hall who had a friend who grew a few plants? Well now it's become big business with Tempe firms buying another to create nation's largest cultivator, processor and retailer. https://tucson.com/arizona-marijuana-firm-buying-another-in-million-deal/article_d2a860ef-31e0-58d2-9a31-079b00a62baf.html …
author: azcapmedia

text: That loaded gun in the glove box? Senate panel OKs proposal to allow it to remain loaded when driving onto school grounds. But questions remain whether it violates federal laws.
author: azcapmedia

text: Remember that House-passed bill by Republicans to let employers pay less to full-time students with part-time jobs? Well one GOP senator (@PaceforAZSenate) is standing in the way amid questions about sending the wrong message to students.
author: azcapmedia
